page.title: 10FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (5).
page.content: { FARM MACHINERY.} Every farm had some kind of machinery. Every farm had at least one{tractor and one farm had eight tractors. The 17 farms had 61 tractors between them, an average of between three and four each. Every single farm had at least one{grass cutter}and many farms had two grass cutters.One even had three. Every farm except one had a {fore-end loader}and a{roller.}Thirteen farms had a{buckrake}and two out of the thirteen kept two buckrakes. There were thirteen farms that kept{harrows, the number of harrows altogether being twenty-one.Twelve farms kept{crop {sprayers,}all having one each. Nine farms had{combine harvesters.}We imagine that the farmers who didn't have one borrowed the other farmer's combines, or hired a contractor.
